trans-unit.source: Profiling
trans-unit.target: Profiling

trans-unit.source: Beginner Programmer
trans-unit.target: Beginner Programmer

trans-unit.source: You can profile your project to check its runtime performance and find problems. Use the Stride Game Profiler script or an external profiling tool such as the Performance Profiler in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: You can profile your project to check its runtime performance and find problems. Use the Stride Game Profiler script or an external profiling tool such as the Performance Profiler in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Profiling
trans-unit.target: Profiling

trans-unit.source: Profile with the Stride Game Profiler script
trans-unit.target: Profile with the Stride Game Profiler script

trans-unit.source: The Game Profiler script shows how performance costs change at runtime. This helps isolate bottlenecks and find their cause.
trans-unit.target: The Game Profiler script shows how performance costs change at runtime. This helps isolate bottlenecks and find their cause.

trans-unit.source: Profiler at runtime
trans-unit.target: Profiler at runtime

trans-unit.source: To use the script:
trans-unit.target: To use the script:

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View, click Add new asset button and select Scripts > Game Profiler.
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View, click Add new asset button and select Scripts > Game Profiler.

trans-unit.source: Add Game Profiler script
trans-unit.target: Add Game Profiler script

trans-unit.source: The New script dialog opens. Leave the default information and click Create script.
trans-unit.target: The New script dialog opens. Leave the default information and click Create script.

trans-unit.source: New script
trans-unit.target: New script

trans-unit.source: Game Studio adds the GameProfiler script to your project.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio adds the GameProfiler script to your project.

trans-unit.source: Add the script to an entity. For instructions, see Use scripts.
trans-unit.target: Add the script to an entity. For instructions, see Use scripts.

trans-unit.source: Select the entity that contains the GameProfiler.
trans-unit.target: Select the entity that contains the GameProfiler.

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid (on the right by default), enable the Game Profiler component.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid (on the right by default), enable the Game Profiler component.

trans-unit.source: Enable component
trans-unit.target: Enable component

trans-unit.source: !Tip You can also enable and disable the profiler at runtime with Left Ctrl + Left Shift + P.
trans-unit.target: !Tip You can also enable and disable the profiler at runtime with Left Ctrl + Left Shift + P.

trans-unit.source: Run the game.
trans-unit.target: Run the game.

trans-unit.source: The Game Profiler shows profiling results as your game runs.
trans-unit.target: The Game Profiler shows profiling results as your game runs.

trans-unit.source: !Note Game Profiler disables VSync. This gives you the true profiling values, ignoring sync time.
trans-unit.target: !Note Game Profiler disables VSync. This gives you the true profiling values, ignoring sync time.

trans-unit.source: Game Profiler properties
trans-unit.target: Game Profiler properties

trans-unit.source: To change the Game Profiler properties, select the GameProfiler entity and use the Property Grid.
trans-unit.target: To change the Game Profiler properties, select the GameProfiler entity and use the Property Grid.

trans-unit.source: Profiler properties
trans-unit.target: Profiler properties

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Filter
trans-unit.target: Filter

trans-unit.source: The kind of information the profiler displays (FPS only, CPU, or GPU). At runtime, change with F1.
trans-unit.target: The kind of information the profiler displays (FPS only, CPU, or GPU). At runtime, change with F1.

trans-unit.source: Sort by
trans-unit.target: Sort by

trans-unit.source: Sort the result pages by:
trans-unit.target: Sort the result pages by:

trans-unit.source: Name: the profile key (the thing being profiled)
trans-unit.target: Name: the profile key (the thing being profiled)

trans-unit.source: Time: the key that uses the most time
trans-unit.target: Time: the key that uses the most time

trans-unit.source: At runtime, toggle with F2.
trans-unit.target: At runtime, toggle with F2.

trans-unit.source: Refresh interval (ms)
trans-unit.target: Refresh interval (ms)

trans-unit.source: How frequently the profiler gets and displays new results. At runtime, control with - / +.
trans-unit.target: How frequently the profiler gets and displays new results. At runtime, control with - / +.

trans-unit.source: Display page
trans-unit.target: Display page

trans-unit.source: The results page displayed. At runtime, jump to a page with the number keys, or move forward and backwards with F3 and F4.
trans-unit.target: The results page displayed. At runtime, jump to a page with the number keys, or move forward and backwards with F3 and F4.

trans-unit.source: Text color
trans-unit.target: Text color

trans-unit.source: The color of the profiler text
trans-unit.target: The color of the profiler text

trans-unit.source: Priority
trans-unit.target: Priority

trans-unit.source: See Scheduling and priorities
trans-unit.target: See Scheduling and priorities

trans-unit.source: Understanding the Game Profiler results
trans-unit.target: Understanding the Game Profiler results

trans-unit.source: The top row displays information about basic performance.
trans-unit.target: The top row displays information about basic performance.

trans-unit.source: FPS profiling
trans-unit.target: FPS profiling

trans-unit.source: Displaying: the kind of information the profiler displays (FPS only, CPU, or GPU)
trans-unit.target: Displaying: the kind of information the profiler displays (FPS only, CPU, or GPU)

trans-unit.source: Frame: the current frame
trans-unit.target: Frame: the current frame

trans-unit.source: Update: the average time (ms) taken to update the game since the profiler last refreshed
trans-unit.target: Update: the average time (ms) taken to update the game since the profiler last refreshed

trans-unit.source: Draw: the average time (ms) taken to render the frame since the profiler last refreshed
trans-unit.target: Draw: the average time (ms) taken to render the frame since the profiler last refreshed

trans-unit.source: FPS: the average number of frames rendered per second
trans-unit.target: FPS: the average number of frames rendered per second

trans-unit.source: If you select CPU as the display mode, the profiler displays:
trans-unit.target: If you select CPU as the display mode, the profiler displays:

trans-unit.source: CPU profiling
trans-unit.target: CPU profiling

trans-unit.source: Total: the amount of memory currently used
trans-unit.target: Total: the amount of memory currently used

trans-unit.source: Peak: the peak memory use since the game started
trans-unit.target: Peak: the peak memory use since the game started

trans-unit.source: Allocations: the amount of memory allocated or freed since the profiler last refreshed
trans-unit.target: Allocations: the amount of memory allocated or freed since the profiler last refreshed

trans-unit.source: Gen0, Gen1, Gen1: the number of garbage collections per each generation of object (Gen0 is the most recent generation)
trans-unit.target: Gen0, Gen1, Gen1: the number of garbage collections per each generation of object (Gen0 is the most recent generation)

trans-unit.source: If you select GPU as the display mode, the profiler displays:
trans-unit.target: If you select GPU as the display mode, the profiler displays:

trans-unit.source: GPU profiling
trans-unit.target: GPU profiling

trans-unit.source: Device: the graphics device (manufacturer's description)
trans-unit.target: Device: the graphics device (manufacturer's description)

trans-unit.source: Platform: the currently used backend (eg DirectX, OpenGL, Vulkan, etc)
trans-unit.target: Platform: the currently used backend (eg DirectX, OpenGL, Vulkan, etc)

trans-unit.source: Profile: the feature level for your game, set in Game Settings > Rendering (see Game settings)
trans-unit.target: Profile: the feature level for your game, set in Game Settings > Rendering (see Game settings)

trans-unit.source: Resolution: the game resolution
trans-unit.target: Resolution: the game resolution

trans-unit.source: Drawn triangles: the number of triangles drawn per frame
trans-unit.target: Drawn triangles: the number of triangles drawn per frame

trans-unit.source: Draw calls: the number of draw calls per frame
trans-unit.target: Draw calls: the number of draw calls per frame

trans-unit.source: Buffer memory: the amount of memory allocated to buffers
trans-unit.target: Buffer memory: the amount of memory allocated to buffers

trans-unit.source: Texture memory: the amount of memory allocated to textures
trans-unit.target: Texture memory: the amount of memory allocated to textures

trans-unit.source: In the GPU and CPU modes, the profiler displays information about the parts of the code being profiled, including active scripts.
trans-unit.target: In the GPU and CPU modes, the profiler displays information about the parts of the code being profiled, including active scripts.

trans-unit.source: Profiler columns
trans-unit.target: Profiler columns

trans-unit.source: !Note Each value describes the events per frame since the last profiler refresh.
trans-unit.target: !Note Each value describes the events per frame since the last profiler refresh.

trans-unit.source: Column
trans-unit.target: Column

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: The total time taken to execute the code in one frame
trans-unit.target: The total time taken to execute the code in one frame

trans-unit.source: Average time taken to execute a single call of the code
trans-unit.target: Average time taken to execute a single call of the code

trans-unit.source: The shortest amount of time taken to execute a single call of the code
trans-unit.target: The shortest amount of time taken to execute a single call of the code

trans-unit.source: The longest amount of time taken to execute a single call of the code
trans-unit.target: The longest amount of time taken to execute a single call of the code

trans-unit.source: The number of times the code was executed in one frame
trans-unit.target: The number of times the code was executed in one frame

trans-unit.source: The number of times per frame marked code is executed. This column is only displayed if marked code is executed
trans-unit.target: The number of times per frame marked code is executed. This column is only displayed if marked code is executed

trans-unit.source: The part of the code (such as a function or script) being profiled. This column also displays additional information, such as the number of entities affected.
trans-unit.target: The part of the code (such as a function or script) being profiled. This column also displays additional information, such as the number of entities affected.

trans-unit.source: Game Profiler runtime controls
trans-unit.target: Game Profiler runtime controls

trans-unit.source: You can change the Game Profiler settings at runtime using keyboard shortcuts.
trans-unit.target: You can change the Game Profiler settings at runtime using keyboard shortcuts.

trans-unit.source: Action
trans-unit.target: Action

trans-unit.source: Control
trans-unit.target: Control

trans-unit.source: Left Ctrl + Left Shift + P
trans-unit.target: Left Ctrl + Left Shift + P

trans-unit.source: Enable/disable the profiler
trans-unit.target: Enable/disable the profiler

trans-unit.source: F1
trans-unit.target: F1

trans-unit.source: Toggle between CPU, GPU, and FPS-only results
trans-unit.target: Toggle between CPU, GPU, and FPS-only results

trans-unit.source: F2
trans-unit.target: F2

trans-unit.source: Toggle between sorting by profile key and time
trans-unit.target: Toggle between sorting by profile key and time

trans-unit.source: / + | Slow down / speed up the refresh time F3 / F4 | Page back / page forward Number keys | Jump to a page
trans-unit.target: / + | Slow down / speed up the refresh time F3 / F4 | Page back / page forward Number keys | Jump to a page

trans-unit.source: Use the Game Profiler in code
trans-unit.target: Use the Game Profiler in code

trans-unit.source: Enable profiling:
trans-unit.target: Enable profiling:

trans-unit.source: GameProfiler.EnableProfiling();
trans-unit.target: GameProfiler.EnableProfiling();

trans-unit.source: Enable profiling only for the profiler keys you specify:
trans-unit.target: Enable profiling only for the profiler keys you specify:

trans-unit.source: GameProfiler.EnableProfiling(true, {mykey1,mykey2});
trans-unit.target: GameProfiler.EnableProfiling(true, {mykey1,mykey2});

trans-unit.source: Enable the profiling except for the profiler keys you specify:
trans-unit.target: Enable the profiling except for the profiler keys you specify:

trans-unit.source: GameProfiler.EnableProfiling(false, {mykey1,mykey2});
trans-unit.target: GameProfiler.EnableProfiling(false, {mykey1,mykey2});

trans-unit.source: To access the prolifing key of a script, use ProfilingKey.
trans-unit.target: To access the prolifing key of a script, use ProfilingKey.

trans-unit.source: Use external profiling tools
trans-unit.target: Use external profiling tools

trans-unit.source: Instead of using the Stride Game Profiler, you can use external profiling tools to profile your project.
trans-unit.target: Instead of using the Stride Game Profiler, you can use external profiling tools to profile your project.

trans-unit.source: Profiler
trans-unit.target: Profiler

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Platforms
trans-unit.target: Platforms

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio feature
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio feature

trans-unit.source: Desktop and mobile
trans-unit.target: Desktop and mobile

trans-unit.source: Standalone tool distributed with Xamarin Studio
trans-unit.target: Standalone tool distributed with Xamarin Studio

trans-unit.source: Mobile
trans-unit.target: Mobile

trans-unit.source: Standalone
trans-unit.target: Standalone

trans-unit.source: Desktop and mobile
trans-unit.target: Desktop and mobile

trans-unit.source: Use the Visual Studio profiler
trans-unit.target: Use the Visual Studio profiler

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio has powerful in-built profiling tools that can identify common performance issues.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio has powerful in-built profiling tools that can identify common performance issues.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open your project solution (.sln) file.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open your project solution (.sln) file.

trans-unit.source: To open the profiler, press Alt + F2, or in the task bar click Analyze > Performance Profiler.
trans-unit.target: To open the profiler, press Alt + F2, or in the task bar click Analyze > Performance Profiler.

trans-unit.source: Launch Visual Studio profiler
trans-unit.target: Launch Visual Studio profiler

trans-unit.source: In the Profiler window, select the profiling tools you want to run.
trans-unit.target: In the Profiler window, select the profiling tools you want to run.

trans-unit.source: Launch Visual Studio profiler
trans-unit.target: Launch Visual Studio profiler

trans-unit.source: You can run multiple profiling tools at once.
trans-unit.target: You can run multiple profiling tools at once.

trans-unit.source: To launch the profiler, in the Performance Profiler tab, at the bottom, click Start.
trans-unit.target: To launch the profiler, in the Performance Profiler tab, at the bottom, click Start.

trans-unit.source: Profiler Start button
trans-unit.target: Profiler Start button

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio runs your application and begins profiling.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio runs your application and begins profiling.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Visual Studio profiler, see the MSDN documentation.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Visual Studio profiler, see the MSDN documentation.

trans-unit.source: Use RenderDoc
trans-unit.target: Use RenderDoc

trans-unit.source: RenderDoc is a free MIT licensed stand-alone graphics debugger that allows quick and easy single-frame capture and detailed introspection of any application using Vulkan, D3D11, OpenGL & OpenGL ES or D3D12 across Windows 7 - 10, Linux, Android, or Nintendo Switch™.
trans-unit.target: RenderDoc is a free MIT licensed stand-alone graphics debugger that allows quick and easy single-frame capture and detailed introspection of any application using Vulkan, D3D11, OpenGL & OpenGL ES or D3D12 across Windows 7 - 10, Linux, Android, or Nintendo Switch™.

trans-unit.source: Download RenderDoc.
trans-unit.target: Download RenderDoc.

trans-unit.source: Optional: This step is optional and only necessary if you want to have render pass markers with name following the Graphics Compositor:
trans-unit.target: Optional: This step is optional and only necessary if you want to have render pass markers with name following the Graphics Compositor:

trans-unit.source: 2.1. In your executable project (Windows), locate game.Run(); and insert the following code just before:
trans-unit.target: 2.1. In your executable project (Windows), locate game.Run(); and insert the following code just before:

trans-unit.source: game.GraphicsDeviceManager.DeviceCreationFlags |= DeviceCreationFlags.Debug;
trans-unit.target: game.GraphicsDeviceManager.DeviceCreationFlags |= DeviceCreationFlags.Debug;

trans-unit.source: !Note If you have a SharpDXException of type DXGI_ERROR_SDK_COMPONENT_MISSING, please follow the instructions from https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/uwp/gaming/use-the-directx-runtime-and-visual-studio-graphics-diagnostic-features
trans-unit.target: !Note If you have a SharpDXException of type DXGI_ERROR_SDK_COMPONENT_MISSING, please follow the instructions from https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/uwp/gaming/use-the-directx-runtime-and-visual-studio-graphics-diagnostic-features

trans-unit.source: 2.2. Also, make sure profiler is enabled by calling this code from any of your game script:
trans-unit.target: 2.2. Also, make sure profiler is enabled by calling this code from any of your game script:

trans-unit.source: GameProfiler.EnableProfiling();
trans-unit.target: GameProfiler.EnableProfiling();

trans-unit.source: Optional: Add a package reference to Stride.Graphics.RenderDocPlugin.
trans-unit.target: Optional: Add a package reference to Stride.Graphics.RenderDocPlugin.

trans-unit.source: You can then use the @'Stride.Graphics.RenderDocManager' class to trigger captures:
trans-unit.target: You can then use the @'Stride.Graphics.RenderDocManager' class to trigger captures:

trans-unit.source: Common bottlenecks
trans-unit.target: Common bottlenecks

trans-unit.source: As CPU and GPU process different types of data, it's usually easy to identify which part is causing a bottleneck.
trans-unit.target: As CPU and GPU process different types of data, it's usually easy to identify which part is causing a bottleneck.

trans-unit.source: Most GPU problems arise when the application uses expensive rendering techniques, such as post effects, lighting, shadows, and tessellation. To identify the problem, disable rendering features.
trans-unit.target: Most GPU problems arise when the application uses expensive rendering techniques, such as post effects, lighting, shadows, and tessellation. To identify the problem, disable rendering features.

trans-unit.source: If instead there seems to be a CPU bottleneck, reduce the complexity of the scene.
trans-unit.target: If instead there seems to be a CPU bottleneck, reduce the complexity of the scene.

trans-unit.source: For graphics:
trans-unit.target: For graphics:

trans-unit.source: decrease the resolution of your game
trans-unit.target: decrease the resolution of your game

trans-unit.source: reduce the quality of your post effects
trans-unit.target: reduce the quality of your post effects

trans-unit.source: reduce the number of lights and size of shadow maps
trans-unit.target: reduce the number of lights and size of shadow maps

trans-unit.source: reduce shadow map sizes
trans-unit.target: reduce shadow map sizes

trans-unit.source: use culling techniques to reduce the number of objects and vertices rendered
trans-unit.target: use culling techniques to reduce the number of objects and vertices rendered

trans-unit.source: For textures:
trans-unit.target: For textures:

trans-unit.source: use compressed textures on slower devices
trans-unit.target: use compressed textures on slower devices

trans-unit.source: use sprite sheets, not individual images
trans-unit.target: use sprite sheets, not individual images

trans-unit.source: use texture atlases, not separate textures
trans-unit.target: use texture atlases, not separate textures

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also
